description: Northern Cyprus has declared a curfew between 9 p.m. to 6 a.m. starting March 31. The curfew will be effective until April 10. People who have to work between those hours will receive a warrant.

Northern Cyprus has declared a curfew between 9 p.m. to 6 a.m. starting March 31. The curfew will be effective until April 10. People who work in essential businesses and essential governmental services will receive a warrant. UPDATE: Curfew was set to end on April 10, however, it has been extended until April 18.

Northern Cyprus has declared a curfew between 9 p.m. to 6 a.m. starting March 31. The curfew will be effective until April 10. People who have to work between those hours will receive a warrant. This curfew has been extended to April 18, then to April 30.

On the March 5, 2020 the TRNC Authorities imposed an external border restriction. Third country nationals who will travel to the TRNC from China, Iran, Iraq, South Korea and Italy, which are considered as high risk countries in terms of COVID-19, will not be admitted to the TRNC from the land, sea and air border gates until further notice.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Starting from March 14, only TRNC citizens and travellers who have a legal permit to enter TRNC will be able to enter the country until April 1. People who enter the country have to go through 14 days of quarantine.

description: Starting from March 14, only TRNC citizens and travellers who have a legal permit to enter TRNC will be able to enter the country until April 1. People who enter the country have to go through 14 days of quarantine. UPDATE: Originally, only TRNC citizens and people with a legal permit were allowed to enter TRNC. Starting on March 19, TRNC citizens' spouses and children were also allowed to enter the country.

description: Starting on March 19, only TRNC citizens, their spouses and children, and people who have a legal permit to enter TRNC will be allowed to enter the country. Regardless of which country they are coming from, they will have to quarantine for 14 days.

description: TRNC doubled the health personnel present on all borders on March 9.

On March 12, TRNC has declared that masks, gloves, medical masks, disinfectants, anticeptics, and alcohols (other than alcoholic beverages) are controlled goods and people who try to stock and/or sell these for higher prices will be punished. The precautions and punishments will be overseen by the Municipality of Economy and Energy.

description: Cabinet of TRNC has bought 15.000 COVID-19 PCR test sets which include viral nucleic acid isolation kit, swabs and viral transport medium (VTM).
Turkey and TRNC started working together on building a 100-bed hospital in TRNC which will be equipped with the latest technology amid the pandemic and the urgent need.

description: Municipality of Gazimağusa is disinfecting all touristic and archeological places inside the county.
Schools and student shuttles will be disinfected by newly-formed teams until March 15.
Teams formed by Ministry of Health and Office of Civil Defense are disinfecting all customs checkpoints.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: TRNC Government made it obligatory to use hand sanitizer while entering and exiting the essential businesses that are open (e.g. pharmacies and grocery stores). People working inside those places are also obligated to use masks and gloves.
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Every office that is functioning should be disinfected at least once a week. Shared spaces in offices such as bathrooms, lifts, cafeteria, etc. should be disinfected every day. Equipments, surfaces, and workspaces should be disinfected regularly. These disinfection processes will be done by the employers, and are regulated by the Ministry of Labor and the National Government of TRNC.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: TRNC declared lockdown for 14 days starting on March 23. People who have been permitted to work (whether it be private businesses or linked to the government) are not bound by this lockdown. The rest of the public can go out of their houses for fundamental necessities.

TRNC declared lockdown for 14 days starting on March 23. People who have been permitted to work (whether it be private businesses or linked to the government) are not bound by this lockdown. The rest of the public can go out of their houses for fundamental necessities. On April 4, the lockdown got extended to last until April 10. UPDATE: The lockdown was set to last until April 6, however, it has been extended to April 10.

Cabinet of TRNC forms a new crisis desk coordinated by the prime minister and led by Ministry of Health on March 9. Ministry of Internal Affairs, Ministry of Public Works and Transportation, Ministry of Tourism and Environment, Chief Police of Immigration, and co-presidents of the Committee of Technical Health with Two Societies are also in the newly-formed crisis desk.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 16, the prime minister of TRNC have formed "Prime Minister's COVID-19 Advisory Council" which includes presidents of meical doctors', dentists', nurses', and midwives' chambers and unions, as well as some prominent doctors. The council will oversee and evaluate the situation in the country closely.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: TRNC is tranferring all patients with COVID-19 to Turkey.

description: Coordinating Committee of Karpaz have put on time restrictions on essential businesses. Pharmacies, supermarkets, butchers, suppliers of livestock food and agricultural pesticides will be open between 8:00-12:00 where they will only accept orders on phone calls, and the delivery of the orders will take place between 12:00-15:00. When butchers' have sold their reserves, they will close. Bakehouses will be open for production between 20:00-08:00 and deliveries to supermarkets, grocery stores, etc. will take place between 08:00-10:00. People who have livestock can take of them between 08:00-18:00 if they live in a different district than their stockyard, and between 08.00-10:00 or 15:00-17:00 if they live in the same district. People who have greenhouses can operate between 08:00-12:00. Beekeepers can operate between 15:00-17:00. In all steps, hygiene will be the first concern.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions

description: All hair and beauty salons in TRNC has to have designated entry and exit points, and the ventilation system has to be checked regularly. People working there and the customers has to wear a mask. Materials such as towels, and combs will be used only once for a person, or can be brought to the shop by the customer. Only one customer can be waiting, and the other customers cannot get service side-by side. Shaving with razors, nail and skin care, permanent make-up are not allowed. Regular sanitation of the shop and seats and tables is required.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)
